subject: Programming
title: The Ariane 5 Explosion
description: A quick win: understand The Ariane 5 Explosion.

hook.text: On June 4, 1996, a brand-new European rocket exploded 37 seconds after liftoff.

buildup.text: Ariane 5 reused navigation software from its predecessor, Ariane 4.

discovery.text: A 64-bit number was squeezed into a 16-bit space. The overflow crashed the guidance system.

twist.text: The faulty code wasn't even needed during flight. It ran a pre-launch calibration check.

climax.text: Half a billion dollars of cargo destroyed by a single type conversion error.

punchline.text: A data type mismatch blew up a rocket.

quiz.question: What caused the Ariane 5 rocket to explode?
options: A fuel leak in the engine
A communication failure with ground control
